title: How to Clean Ring Around the Collar with a Bar of Soap

steps.headline: Keep a bar of bath soap in the wash area, and do not use it for bathing.
steps.description: Keeping the bar of soap, close by, is your reminder to use it. More importantly, by not using this bar of soap for bathing, the bar of soap will be dry and not slippery.

steps.headline: Have a brush for cleaning by pounding.
steps.description: Set aside a brush just for this purpose in the wash area. Any type of brush with a stiff bristle will do. The brush must be of some size and heft, for example it would be useless to try to pound on a stain with a toothbrush sized brush. It is very easy to remove ring around the collar, without pounding it, by agitating it, but agitating will wear out the fabric very quickly and create itchy fuzzballs.

steps.headline: Wet the ring around the collar area and just that area only to avoid a mess.
steps.description: Place the shirt on the inside of a basin or on the flat part of a washboard. Pre-soaking is an option before all this.

steps.headline: One of your hands is now wet, so use the other hand to grasp the bar of soap and grind it into the fabric.
With the brush, pound on the fabric for a minute (or two minutes if you have the energy).
steps.description: Sprinkle a little water, on the brush or fabric, when pounding the fabric.

steps.headline: Wash your shirt like you normally do.
steps.description: Notice how well the ring around the collar was cleaned without agitation, or bleach, and just a bar of soap.
